medical_history.chief_complaint: Desquamating rash on soles of feet and hands and in oral mucosa, right upper extremity pain and swelling.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient had been off of IV heroin for several years until using it again recently on her birthday. She developed right upper extremity pain and swelling and came to the ED. After treatment with antibiotics, the rash on her arm improved, but redness of palms and feet developed. Reports chills but no fevers.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Eosinophilia, Hepatitis C, distant history of lumbar osteomyelitis, polysubstance abuse (currently on methadone), anxiety, depression, hypertension, history of endocarditis, chronic bronchitis.
